group_1.textLeft: Uh… There’s this little boy...
He always fails to complete the tasks he’s asked @to do,
but his mother never ever scolds him…
One day, when the little boy returns after @successfully completing his task,
his mother praises him more than he’s ever been praised before.
From then on, the little boy never fails at any of his tasks ever again.
S-Sorry, Ui-chan…
I felt like it might be the case, but I really haven’t thought-out the content enough that others could listen to it…

group_1.textRight: No, I should apologize. I’m sorry for asking @something selfish…

group_1.textLeft: Um… Ui-chan.
Have you heard Nemu-chan’s stories before…?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, all the time when we were hospitalized.

group_1.textLeft: Nemu-chan’s stories are fascinating, and everyone @says they’re amazing…

group_1.textRight: Yep.
I’m always really happy I get to hear them @ahead of everyone else.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, I see…
(Compared to Nemu-chan’s stories,)
(mine couldn’t possibly hold a candle to hers…)
...I have a lot of ideas that I want to convey,
but in reality I only recently decided I want to @express them through picture books,
so I don’t even know if I’m fit to be a picture book author or not…

group_1.textRight: Hmm…
But, “Having something you want to convey is @the most important part of being a writer.”
That’s what Nemu-chan said.
Therefore you’re definitely fit to be an author!

group_1.textLeft: I certainly do have things I want to say,
but I’m not sure how to write them into a story…

group_1.textRight: Well… Nemu-chan once said
that as we read more and more,
we start seeing the manner in which well-executed stories are put together.
I’m pretty sure she’s said she reads a book a day because of that, no matter how busy she is…

group_1.textLeft: [chara:100401:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Eh, she reads that fast…!?

group_1.textRight: Nemu-chan’s so amazing. I’d never be able to @replicate that…

group_1.textLeft: Yeah…
(I… take a week to read just one book…)
Guess I underestimated what it takes to be @an author...
Even though I’ll have to put in more effort than Nemu-chan…

group_1.textRight: Ah, um... Er…
I think you’ll be fine as long as you work hard @in the future…!?

group_1.textLeft: ...Thank you, Ui-chan...
...I’m a bit disheartened, but nothing major…
I really am starting from zero, and now I know @I’m not working hard enough...
However, my desire to create picture books and @help all kinds of people is real.

group_1.textRight: Yeah…! And I’ll be cheering you on, Sana-san.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you…!
To start off, I want to do some writing, just to @practice.
Even if it’s rubbish, I won’t get anything done @without beginning to write...

group_1.textRight: Ah, Nemu-chan’s also said
that a lot of things won’t become clear until you @write them down.

group_1.textLeft: That’s good to hear...
...Oh, right. Is this still of any use…?

group_1.textRight: That’s…?

group_1.textLeft: It’s a book called “The Crafting of a Story”...
I bought it as a reference for whenever I began @writing.
An author I like wrote it, so I was curious...
Um…
“People who are stuck and unable to write @their stories”
“should first settle on one main idea.”
I might have had too many things I wanted to say, @so I didn’t whittle down the possibilities...

group_1.textRight: Then to practice, why don’t you decide on a single topic?
Doesn’t have to be anything that out-there, maybe some subject matter that’s caught your attention recently…?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm… [chara:100401:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:100401:cheek_0][chara:100401:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json:motion_0][chara:100401:lipSynch_1]Ah!
There was something I became interested in @not long ago…!
